intro: Argostemmella gracilis, commonly known as the slender argostemmoid, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and prairies. Its leaves are alternate and linear, often with a slight pubescence. The flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer, are usually pink or white and attract various pollinators.
